comments.body: This is just a reference to the list, **not a copy**. The list is emptied by `root_logger.removeHandler()` further down. So you end up with an empty list of handlers when you later try to reset.

@@ -1,1 +65,69 @@    ti = dag_run.get_task_instance(task.task_id)
    ti.task = task
    return ti

comments.body:
I was wondering if it makes sense to add `ti.refresh_from_db()` in to this path, and I think probably yes, even though only one of the tasks _needs_ it, this makes it predictable I think.

We can then remove the call on L250.

Thoughts?
Yes. Having it refreshed here is the best!
